intro: Calostephane divaricata, commonly known as the variable calostephane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Calostephane divaricata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
